resources.string: Do you know about outer space?\n Let\'s test how much you are aware about it.\n Either way you will learn something new today.
Well Done!\nWe are almost done.\nLet\'s submit and checkout the score.
Wow! that\'s a great score.\n Congrats you have scored above many users.
Which galaxy contains our Solar System?
Which are the moons of Mars?
Can you hear sounds in space?
No. Sound waves need a medium to travel through, and since there is no atmosphere in outer space there is utter silence.
False. A planet is a celestial body that is in orbit around the Sun, while a star is a luminous ball of gas held together by its own gravity.
Which of these planets has no moons?
Both Mercury and Venus are moon-less.
Which of these refers to the mass over which a star will become a black hole?
It\'s named after Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar, the physicist who independently calculated the limit at the age of 19 in India. The Planck mass is much, much, much smaller.
Which of these can be formed in a supernova?
A supernova can form a black hole or a neutron star. A white dwarf form when a star doesn\'t have a large enough mass to go supernova.
The Andromeda Galaxy (M31) is the closest large galaxy to the Milky Way and is one of a few galaxies that can be seen unaided from the Earth.
